definition: Chiang Kai-shek (1887-1975), military leader, head of the Nationalist government in China 1928-1949 and the government in exile on Taiwan 1950-1975
surname Jiang/refers to Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
to introduce/to lie between/between/shell/armor
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
surname Shi

sentences.english: After Sun Yat- sen came Chiang Kai- shek, who brought the Kuomintang' s military power to its zenith.
sentences.chinese: 蔣介石代替孫中山，創造了國民黨的全盛的軍事時代。

sentences.english: Unquestionably Chiang had the superior-looking war machine.
sentences.chinese: 毫無疑問，蔣介石的戰爭機器看來是處於優勢的。

sentences.english: It was his son, Chiang Ching-kuo, who will be remembered for ushering in political reform.
sentences.chinese: 因引入政治改革而被人銘記的是蔣介石的兒子蔣經國。

sentences.english: In advance, Li asked for instructions from Jiang's superiors about the dress at inauguration.
sentences.chinese: 事先，李宗仁向蔣介石請示典禮服問題。

sentences.english: By doing so, we could ruin Chiang Kai - shek's vicious counter-revolutionary strategy.
sentences.chinese: 這樣就可以擊破蔣介石反革命的毒辣的戰略方針。

sentences.english: That emergency was now on them and the generalissimo , himself, flew to Manchuria.
sentences.chinese: 現在局勢確很危急，蔣介石親自飛來滿洲督戰。

sentences.english: For instance, we stood in diametrical opposition to Chiang Kai-shek's Kuomintang.
sentences.chinese: 比如，我們和蔣介石國民黨就是根本對立的。

sentences.english: Whampoa and its alumni were the base on which Chiang’s power was built.
sentences.chinese: 黃埔軍校以及其校友是蔣介石賴以建立其權力的基石。

sentences.english: When, if ever, did he oppose Chiang Kai-shek or imperialism?
sentences.chinese: 他什麼時候反過蔣介石，反過帝國主義呢？

sentences.english: But this government was later merged into Chiang Kai-shek's government in Nanjing.
sentences.chinese: 但是不久後就與蔣介石的南京政府聯姻合併了。

sentences.english: One casualty of this has been the reputation of the Republic’s leader, Chiang Kai-shek.
sentences.chinese: 民國領袖蔣介石的名聲便是其中一個受害者。

sentences.english: Jiang Jieshi has also implemented the policy he banned, banned the book not less than.
sentences.chinese: 蔣介石也實行禁書政策，他查禁的書不會少於清朝。

sentences.english: Almost at the same time, Madame Chiang threw in her lot with the generalissimo.
sentences.chinese: 差不多也就在這個時候，宋美齡嫁給了蔣介石。

sentences.english: To his surprise, Jiang appeared in the hall, wearing long gown.
sentences.chinese: 可是，卻見蔣介石着一身長袍馬褂來到禮堂。

sentences.english: Later, on Chiang's orders, the 19th Route Army was transferred to Fukien to fight the Red Army again.
sentences.chinese: 隨後，十九路軍又被蔣介石調到福建去同紅軍作戰。

sentences.english: Stilwell thought the influence of Madame on her husband was along the right lines.
sentences.chinese: 史迪威認爲宋美齡對蔣介石的影響有良好的一面。

definition: Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党/same as 孫逸仙|孙逸仙
Mao Zedong (1893-1976), Chinese communist leader
Guomindang or Kuomintang (KMT)/Nationalist Party
Soong Mei-ling (1898-2003), Chiang Kai-shek's second wife
Nationalist government 1920s-1949 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
Zhang Xueliang (1901-2001) son of Fengtian clique warlord, then senior general for the Nationalists and subsequently for the People's Liberation Army
war of resistance, especially the war against Japan (1937-1945)
Japanese army/Japanese troops
Zhou Enlai (1898-1976), Chinese communist leader, prime minister 1949-1976
Yuan Shikai (1859-1916), senior general of late Qing, subsequently warlord and self-proclaimed emperor of China
Hu Shi (1891-1962), original proponent of writing in colloquial Chinese 白話文|白话文[bai2 hua4 wen2]
Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972
Wang Ching-wei (1883-1944), left-wing Guomingdang politician, subsequently Japanese collaborator
Song Qingling or Rosemonde Soong (1893-1981), wife of Sun Yat-sen 孫中山|孙中山[Sun1 Zhong1 shan1]
Communist Party
(China's) War of Resistance against Japan (1937-1945)
